just for jollies, try running top....

on my system (athlon 2400+ with either 0.5 or 1.0 gig ram) top is showing 
about 98-99% user cpu cycles but does not show the task(s) that is/are 
consuming the resources.  ps also fails to show anything other than X and 
firefox taking anything more than 1-2% of the cpu cycles.    AND while this 
going on keyboard response is fine.  I thought at first it was some filters 
and post processing stuff I had put in but disabling them did not change 
anything.  This was on my list to try to chase *next* week.


At 07:23 PM 1/21/2005, you wrote:


>Hello,
>
>I'm a newbie testing out heritrix for a new project.  I have used
>1.2.0 but found the OOM errors to be a bit of a roadblock.  So, I
>have downloaded and compiled 1.3.0 and am using the bdb.  This seems
>to have eliminated my oom errors, but performance is very poor.
>
>I have loaded up 75,000 seeds into my seed list (after setting up
>the job but before running it).  The box is a dual 3.06 P4 w/ 2 GB
>of ram.  I have tested this on SUSE Ent 9 and RHES 3.0 w/ java 1.4.
>I seem to be crawling about 5-10 pages per second w/ 100 threads.
>What's wierd though is that my CPU and disk are not maxed out.  It
>looks like there's plenty of resources to spare, but I can't get it
>to crawl faster.  Decreasing or increasing the threads makes it
>worse.  There is plenty of bandwidth available too.
>
>Anyway, I noticed that most of the threads are sitting in the
>postselector in a ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR state.  Is this normal?
>Is this my bottleneck?
>
>Any help and/or advice would be great.
>
>Thanks,
>Greg
